lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Ward Connerly's argument is that by eliminating affirmative action, enrollment of blacks and women in universities will increase (Op-Ed, April 29). This is backed up by neither history nor research but a platitude: "When the bar is raised, we rise to the occasion." This conventional work-ethic wisdom might sound good, but it is hardly a solution to the racial and social inequalities that impede equal access to education.

headline.main: Affirmative Action Is No Bar to Ambition
